title: Offer an option to make validator monitor logs less verbose
body:
## Description

This is not a bug report, but a feature request.

When a beacon chain handles hundreds of validators, the info-level logs become a bit too verbose and the log size increases proportionally with the number of validators. If these logs are aggregated by cloud platforms (AWS and Google Cloud) for monitoring and future analysis, the verbosity translates into a bigger bill.

It will be great if we can either 1) turn off INFO logs and only collect more critical log entries (but please output something per epoch to make sure we know the node is still live and functional), or 2) aggregate information for all validators into a single log entry per epoch, probably with _avg_, _max_, _min_, and _count_ values of some metrics, or 3) sample logs somehow, like 1 out of N.
@dong77 You can set `--debug-level warn` to get only the warn, error and crit logs. However, that won't satisfy the requirement of logging something per epoch.

Thank you, @pawanjay176 . However, I think some WARN logs are still too verbose and can be aggregated into **one entry per slot  (or epoch)** instead of using **one entry per validator per slot (or epoch)**.


Note that I replaced my validator IDs with ****** for privacy.

I've also experienced issues with the validator monitor being too verbose in Prometheus metrics with our 5k validator machines on Pyrmont.

I think figuring out how to be more quiet here is a good idea. I like the idea of aggregating the logs like @dong77 suggested.
@dong77 working on reducing the verbosity in #2606
